info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 4:13AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Greenville, north central Anderson and central Pickens Counties through 445 AM EST... At 413 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Pickens to 10 miles north of Clemson. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Easley, Pickens, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville and Berea. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
